text: language notes topic five meals and
mealtimes part one there are many words
in English that have a direct
translation in other languages breakfast
is one example you know this word
breakfast
is the first meal of the day you also
understand the meanings of lunch and
dinner although we all understand
breakfast lunch and dinner we experience
these events these meals in different
ways you know there are variations from
family to family and of course from
culture to culture particularly in terms
of when exactly these meals are eaten
what foods are eaten and how they're
eaten in this lesson I'd like to talk
about meals and mealtimes in the u.s.
let's talk about the first meal of the
day
breakfast breakfast can be eaten
anywhere from about 6:00 a.m. to 9:00 or
even 10:00 a.m. it all depends on the
lifestyle of the person or the family
who goes to work outside the home who
goes to school on a school day or a work
day breakfast is eaten early when it's
the weekend breakfast can be eaten later
in the morning breakfast is not always a
sit-down meal for busy active Americans
breakfast is eaten on the go
so we have things called breakfast
drinks and breakfast bars some Americans
then open the drink open the bar and
take breakfast with them as they walk to
school or go to the bus stop some have a
car and they eat breakfast in the car
they use a drive-thru some restaurants
and some cafes or coffee shops have
drive throughs people go in their car
they order a cup of coffee maybe a
pastry they receive their food and they
continue on in their car eating their
breakfast some school cafeterias serve
breakfast in fact many do so a good
number of school children eat breakfast
at school before classes begin Americans
have hot and cold foods for breakfast
here are some common choices a bagel
with cream cheese doughnuts coffee and a
muffin waffles
cold cereal meaning cereal with cold
milk pancakes with syrup and orange
juice is a favorite
breakfast foods are loved by many in
fact we have some restaurants family
restaurants usually that serve breakfast
all day long so you can go at 10 o'clock
at night and order eggs and toast and a
cup of orange juice after breakfast
comes lunch
lunch is usually eaten around 12 o'clock
noon most restaurants begin serving
lunch at 11 a.m. when a person eats
lunch depends on their school schedule
their work schedule or maybe their
personal preference school cafeterias
serve a hot lunch but for many lunch can
be a cold meal sandwiches are a popular
choice for lunch if a person is at work
the typical lunch break is one hour many
choose not to buy their lunch they
choose to pack a lunch and when you pack
a lunch you have a lunch bag there are
two kinds of lunch bags the first is a
reusable lunch bag many school children
most school children in fact are
encouraged to use a reusable lunch bag
okay so this is a typical lunch bag
there's also a brown paper bag in fact
we have the saying brown bag on brown
bagging it if your brown bagging it it
means you're bringing your lunch from
home usually in this kind of paper bag
I've already mentioned sandwiches as a
common lunch food a very common
combination or combo is soup and
sandwich or soup and salad you'll find
these combos on many lunch menus
at US restaurants
the third meal of the day is dinner in
the u.s. you might also hear the word
supper there are some families in which
the word dinner refers to the midday
meal and supper refers to the evening
meal however for the majority of
Americans the words dinner and supper
are synonymous they have the same
meaning I think dinner is the more
common word dinner can be eaten anywhere
from about 5 p.m. to 8 p.m.
however dinner at 8 o'clock or later
it's considered very late in the u.s.
most restaurants begin serving dinner at
around 5:00 the average time for dinner
is probably 6 o'clock p.m. dinner in the
u.s. is a sit-down meal it's a hot meal
and it's a family meal there are
different kinds of dinner events
sometimes you'll get invited to dinner
and you should ask to be polite what can
I bring the people inviting you to
dinner are called the host and hostess
this is the man this is the woman the
host or hostess might tell you oh don't
bring anything just bring yourself it's
still polite to bring something like a
bouquet of flowers invited guests if
they're allowed to bring something or
asked to bring something choose a wine
or perhaps a dessert to share at a
potluck dinner each guest is expected to
bring a dish to share with the whole
party
if it's a large party there might be a
buffet or buffet stove
meaning all the dishes are placed on one
long table the guests come up they serve
themselves and then go back to smaller
tables and sit down and eat while a
buffet might have many different dishes
a typical American dinner might look
something like this with meat vegetables
and a side dish of perhaps potatoes or
rice
desert quite often follows dinner
sometimes dessert is fresh fruit but in
terms of sweets some common choices are
cookies cake and ice cream these sweet
foods might be eaten with a cup of
coffee or cup of tea
this is the end of part 1 please go on
to part 2 please visit my website today
at WWE English with Jennifer calm you'll
find study tips interactive exercises
vocabulary videos and more
